H0.text: Weigh the mineral is the action that should be taken to identify the streak of a mineral during an investigation.

H1.text: Dip the mineral in acid is the action that should be taken in order to identify the streak of a mineral during an investigation.

H2.text: Heat the mineral until it melts is the action taken to identify the streak of a mineral during an investigation.

H3.text: Dragging an edge of the mineral across a tile is the action taken to identify the streak of a mineral during an investigation.

A4.text: The streak of a mineral is the color of the powder produced when it is dragged across an unweathered surface.

A5.text: The surface across which the mineral is dragged is called a 'streak plate', and is generally made of unglazed porcelain tile.
